TI: [The effect of destruction of the hippocampus and removal of the epiphysis on the circadian dynamics of mobility in stressed rats].
AB: Acute swimming stress destroyed the circadian rhythm of motility in rats. Bilateral electrolytic lesion of the dorsal hippocampus increased the night activity and resistance of animals to stress. Pinealectomy did not affect the circadian locomotion but increased rats' sensitivity to dysrhythmic stress effect.
TT: Vliianie razrusheniia gippokampa i udaleniia epifiza na sutochnuiu dinamiku podvizhnosti stressirovannykh krys.
TA: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova
JT: Zhurnal vysshei nervnoi deiatelnosti imeni I P Pavlova
SO: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova. 1998 Nov-Dec;48(6):1065-72.
